content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is on the phone, Chandler and Monica are sitting in the living room, and Ross is in the kitchen as Rachel enters from her bedroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Phoebe, are you still on hold? I was supposed to call my Dad back like two hours ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, he clipped on, he said call him as soon as you get a chance, he’s at Flimby’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s Flimby’s?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, that’s the word I use when I can’t remember the real thing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Hang up! That’s it! Come on!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Rachel, that’s what they want me to do. My warranty expires tomorrow, if I don’t get through, they’re not gonna fix my crappy, broken phone for free! We cannot let them win! It’s us versus them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ye-e-es!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, listen I gotta double check for tickets tonight. Who-who got what?

content.speaker: Chandler, Phoebe, and Rachel
content.text: I had one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I need two. I’m bringing Pete. My boyfriend. I have a boyfriend now!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Two it is. Ross, how about you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, yeah, I ah, I also need two.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Who’s number two?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who’s number two? One of the more difficult games sewer workers play.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, no, it’s-it’s just this person.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Like a date type (looks at Rachel) person?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, kinda. It’s this woman from work. I hope that won’t be too weird. Will it, Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No, not at all, not at all. I actually was gonna bring someone myself, so…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you said one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I meant, me plus one!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (to Phoebe and Chandler) Did ah, you guys mean you plus one?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I’ll see you tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, bye-bye!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye-bye!
(Ross exits)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I need a date! (runs to her bedroom)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne. I hope she likes it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what are you doing?! It’s never gonna happen, she’s seeing somebody.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The green bottle next to the shaving cream.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Worm medicine for the duck.
(In horror, Joey wipes his next and smells it.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is getting ready to go to Joey’s premiere and Phoebe is still on hold.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go. You can wear this. (hands her a sweater)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (on phone) Ooh, I’m setting the phone down. (does so) But I’m still here! Just don’t go anywhere I’m still here. (starts to put on the sweater) Don’t-don’t switch or anything, ‘cause I’m, I’m right here. (She has pulled the sweater over her head, but her head is stuck in a sleeve.) Just one sec. One sec! One second!! (She is now frantically trying to get the sweater on, as Monica returns from the bathroom.) Wait! One second! Just…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! Monica, I’m scared!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. Honey, that’s-that’s a sleeve. Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And! We also have speaker phone. (She turns on the speaker phone.)

content.speaker: Hold Voice
content.text: Please, stay on the line. Your call is important to us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, wait, you gotta hang up ‘cause we’re gonna be late.
(Phoebe starts to hang up the phone, but…)

content.speaker: Hold Voice
content.text: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes!! Yes!! I’m the next caller! You were gonna have me hang up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Can you take a duck and a chick to the theatre?
content.parenthetical: entering, carrying the chick and duck

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. I just wanted them to hear it from somebody else.

content.description: Joey’s Premiere, Rachel is already there with her date, Tommy, as Ross and his date, Cailin, arrive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How are you? (She goes to kiss him on the cheek, but stops because of the dates and pats him on the shoulder.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So it’s looks like we’re the first ones here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, looks that way. First ones here! Wooo!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yay!!
(An awkward silence follows.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Tommy, this is Ross. Ross, Tommy.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. Oh, I’m sorry, this is Cailin.
(They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they’re arms to shake each other’s hand, and Ross says…)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And! Break!!
(Awkward laughter follows.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, uhh, I think I’m going to run to the ladies room.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Cailin
content.text: I’ll join you.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: I’ll get our seats.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (The girls leave.) (to Tommy) So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is awkward.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well y’know ‘cause Rachel and I used to go out.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Well then this is awkward. So what do you uh…

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: I think we’re here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Yeah.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (sees two people sitting in their seats.) Uh, huh. Excuse me, I’m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Umm, no, I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Can-can we take a look at your ticket?

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Sure. (Hands him the ticket.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep! Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh…

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Oh, well I thought that ah…

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Oh, you thought, huh? Yeah, well that didn’t really work out too well for you did it you idiot !! What are you?! A moron!! Huh?! It says D-13! Okay?! Look you’re surrounded by even numbers!! Did that give you some clue?!

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Uh, the usher told us to come…

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Oh! Oh! The usher must be right! What, with all that training they go through! Get out!! (They start to leave.) Here! (He throws him back his ticket.) (to Ross, calmly) Hey man, you want the aisle?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I’m good. (He sits down, stunned.)

content.description: The Theatre, at the post premiere party. The gang is already there, except Phoebe. Joey runs in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There he is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s our star!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, so, what’d ya think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Almost as good as that play with the two naked girls on the see-saw.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I-I wasn’t in that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh, hey-hey, Kate! Listen I want you to meet everybody. Everybody, this is Kate.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Excuse me. Excuse me. (to Kate) Sweetheart! (Kisses her.) Come! (They leave.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So that’s the girl you like.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you, this guy Rachel is with is crazy! Okay? He viscously screamed at total strangers! I think he’s baaad news!
content.parenthetical: drags Chandler over to buffet table

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute, you don’t like the guy Rachel’s dating? Well, that’s odd.
[cut to Joey, Rachel, and Tommy.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey, Lauren. Uh, you guys this is, this is Kate’s understudy, Lauren.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi!

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey. Gosh, you look soo familiar.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Oh, yeah! I-I ran into you in the hallway in your building. It was right after I slept with Joey. He dumped me the next day.
[cut to Monica, Pete, and Cailin]

content.speaker: Cailin
content.text: So. How’d you guys meet?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well ah, the short version is, I ah pursued her for a couple of months, then I gave her a check for 20,000 dollars, and she was mine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short version.
[cut to Joey as Estelle, Joey’s agent, approaches]

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Joey, sweetheart, you were fabulous!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you guys, this is my agent, Estelle.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: How do you do. (to Rachel and Monica) Ooh, you two girls were outstanding! (to Joey) Did they have representation?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, they-they weren’t in the play.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re not actors.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Ooh, what a shame! Because with her face (points to Monica) and her chest (points to Rachel) I could really put something together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could I borrow it?
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Cailin
content.text: Hi! Remember me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! Yeah! Tommy’s in line for the bathroom and someone just cut in front of him, I think he’s gonna snap. (He’s watching very intently)

content.speaker: Cailin
content.text: Ross, I’m gonna go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go? Why?

content.speaker: Cailin
content.text: I don’t know. Could be because I don’t feel like standing around all night waiting for some guy who may or may not scream.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But-but Cailin, he definitely will scream.

content.speaker: Cailin
content.text: Good bye Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, oh-ho bye.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Here we go people! (starts reading the review) Boxing Day! The Lucille Lortel Theatre, blah-la-la-la… Ah-ha! Joey Tribianni, gives an uneven performance, but Mr. Tribianni is not the worst thing in this production.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!!! Ha-ha-ha!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Kate Miller’s awkward and mannered portrayal is laughable. (Kate walks away depressed.) Badda-badda-badda. Ah-ha! Here it is! The direction by Marshal Talmant is… (stops, reads it again, and throws down the paper in disgust) Thank you, boys and girls, you’ve ruined my life. Please, stuff your talentless faces with my Mother’s crab cakes! (starts to leave) Excuse me!!
(Joey steps in a picks up the paper, the gang all look at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anyone mind if I save this?

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are returning. Phoebe is still on hold.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, is the play over?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. Where were you?

content.speaker: Hold Voice
content.text: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nah. I kept myself busy.
(Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living room with confused looks on their faces.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, yeah. (to Monica) I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff in your room.
(They both look at each other, nod their heads ‘All right’ and follow their stuff into their new rooms.)

content.description: The Theatre, after the party. Joey is trying to comfort Kate.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Are you okay?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Fabulous.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, drama critics they’re nothing but, but people who couldn’t make it as actors. You know what you should do?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Become a drama critic!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: I am hurt! (to Joey and Kate) A plague on both your houses! (walks away)

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, classy.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yep! I sure know how to pick ‘em, huh? Y’know I gave up a part on a soap for this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Really. What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, de-clawing cats. Hey, tell ya what. Let me walk you home. We’ll stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Why the Post?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you didn’t see the Post?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: No. You?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. Why?

content.description: Kate’s Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the town.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, absolutely! You’re talented and you’re good looking.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Oh, you’re sweet and cute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! That’s why they trashed me!
(They kiss.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I, I don’t get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: What? So you never went out with an actress before?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kate, do you even like me?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Of course I do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well so, how come you blew me off? Y’know? How come you were with him?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I don’t know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy… Why can’t I just pick someone like you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you’re just so, you’re so, so… (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Okay, okay, hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let’s get your feet up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I’m gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl.
content.parenthetical: Checks to see if she’s drooling on his shirt.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Phoebe is STILL on hold.]

content.speaker: Hold Voice
content.text: Please stay on the line. You’re call is very important to us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pheebs, you’ve been up for 24 hours! Go to sleep, honey. Th-this isn’t healthy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, I’m fine, and y’know why? ‘Cause of all the riboflavin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Didn’t you have that outfit on last night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! I stayed at Kate’s, but ah, nothing happened. Hey, Pheebs, where were ya?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m so, so, so sorry, Joey. I definitely am gonna see you’re play. I swear you’re play is very important to us, thank you for your patience. You’re play is the next play is the next play I’m gonna see.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anyway, how did it go with Kate?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it was great! Yeah, I-I walked her home, and it was amazing how much we connected, y’know? Then ah, then she passed out, but then she woke up. Yeah? And we stayed up all night talking, and now we’re like totally crazy about each other!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, you had the night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When two people finally realise their feelings for each other, and-and they talk for hours, and they-they learn all about the other person!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You-you think?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you like learn about her family?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Two brothers, one died!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! (They hug, triumphantly.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are sitting on the couch, Rachel is on the chair.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: This is from the woman at the bar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-ho-ho-ho.
(He turns and looks at her. The woman whispers something to Gunther; who comes back and takes the mug away from Chandler.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Sorry. She thought you were somebody else.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What time is it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: One.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: 7:15. (Monica looks at him) Watch doesn’t work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tommy’s supposed to be here soon, we’re going to lunch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look. Look, I wasn’t going to say anything to you, but… All right, I don’t think you should be seeing Tommy anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! The guy is mean. I mean really mean. I think you should stay away from him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, or , maybe, I should stay away from all men.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s not just ‘cause I’m jealous. (Both Monica and Chandler give him a ‘Come on’ look) I mean I’m not, I’m not, I’m not jealous, okay? It’s… Look, the guy, he screamed, he actually screamed at this couple sitting in our seats.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, and at the end of the play, he, he got up y’know, and he just started like, (claps his hands) banging his hands together!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, fine, fine. You don’t want to believe me? No, that’s fine. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re kidding!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross, don’t. Ross!
[cut to outside of Central Perk]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t want to believe me, I’m Mr. Funny to you. Mr. Funny… (turns around and almost spills his coffee on Tommy)

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Whoa!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, sorry Tommy.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: What’s in the cup, Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm…

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: What is in the cup?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it’s coffee.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Ice coffee? Tell me it’s ice coffee!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s-it’s hot…

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Hot coffee!!! You idiot!! You were gonna spill hot coffee all over me, huh?!! What are you just some big, dumb, stupid, doofy idiot, with a doofy idiot hairdo, huh?! Huh?!
[cut to inside Central Perk, we see Ross quietly tapping on the window, desperately trying to get the gang’s attention, while Tommy is still screaming at him]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s your favourite thing about summertime?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, going to the beach. When it stays light real late.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah…

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: (happily) Hey!
content.parenthetical: entering, finished with yelling at Ross, who follows him in shell shocked

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tommyyyy! Say, what’s your favourite thing about summer?

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Ooh, I don’t know. Probably the smell of freshly cut grass.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh, that’s a good one.
(Ross is having a fit, about how calm Tommy is now)

content.description: Backstage at Joey’s play, Joey is arriving, late.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry! Sorry, I’m late; sorry, I’m late! My duck and my chick and a fight, it-it was ugly.

content.speaker: Stage Manager
content.text: Look, we held the curtain for you buddy. Come on, let’s go! Let’s go!
[cut to onstage with Lauren standing in for Kate, the doorbell rings.]

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Vic! Where have you been, baby?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: (hugs her) (whispering) Where’s Kate?

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: She got a job in L.A.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: I’ve been waiting up all night for ya. Where have you been? (Joey doesn’t answer) Where have you been? Vic?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, ahh, go to the window. I’m wanna run down to the truck and show you something.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: What do you got down there, Vic? What do you got under that tarp?
content.parenthetical: at the window, she’s looking down out of the window

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: (whispering) When is she leaving?
content.parenthetical: grabs the window from the outside and sticks his head in

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Tonight. What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m coming up!
content.parenthetical: making like he is yelling up to the second floor

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Ross are in the kitchen, Rachel and Monica are sitting in the living room, and Phoebe is, you guessed it, still on hold.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Hey, mind if I use the phone?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I… (starts jabbering incoherently)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why don’t you use ours across the hall, ‘cause she…has…problems.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-ho, whoa! Sorry, Tommy. I almost spilled this hot coffee on you.
content.parenthetical: coming out of the kitchen with a cup of coffee, almost running into Tommy

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Yeah, but you didn’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, but it’s-it’s-it’s hot!
(We see Tommy go into Joey and Chandler’s apartment)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, would you just stop it! It’s getting really old.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe no one believes me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I do, I believe you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You do Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. But I also believed her (points to the phone) when she said I was next.
[cut to Chandler and Joey’s apartment, Tommy is using the phone]

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Ooh, hey! Hey, there little fella. (picks up the chick) Mr. Fuzzy-Man, how are you doing? (starts to pet him) Aww. (The chick poops on his hand.) Eww! Oh! Eww! Gross! Idiot!! Stupid little, fuzzy, yellow creature!! Oh look at me, I’m so cute, I’m a little chick who’s disgusting! God, you’re so stupid, how are you not yet extinct!! (the duck wattles behind him and quacks) (to the duck) Quack-quack, quack-quack!! What are you quacking about?! Dumb Donald Doo-Doo!!
(We see the gang staring at him through the doorways.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Step away from the duck.

content.speaker: Tommy
content.text: Ooh, sorry little Mr. Chic-A-Dee, sorry you went doody in my hand! (starts to walk out and stops) (to Rachel) Well, I guess we’re not going out anymore. Whaa!!!
(He leaves the gang in stunned silence.)

content.description: Backstage at Joey’s play, Joey is changing for the next scene as Kate arrives, carrying her bags.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I’m soo glad I caught you, I couldn’t find you before.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wh-wh-what’s going on? Wh-what’s this about L.A.?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: They still want me for General Hospital .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But, but wh-what about us?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Last night was wonderful. But I-I can’t stay here just for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, so, stay for the museums!

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Stage Manager
content.text: Joey, onstage!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well can you at least stay to the end of the play? I mean, I’ll go to the airport with ya, I-I wanna say good bye.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Where are you Vic?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Flight’s in an hour. I-I gotta go.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Vic! Vic! Vic !!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In a minute!!
[cut to the end of the play]

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: So this is it? Victor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I guess it is. (sees Kate is watching, he turns Lauren so that he can talk directly to Kate, but still look like he is talking to Lauren) Listen, I ah, I gotta say good bye, and-and I gotta say it quick ‘cause this is killing me. One thing you gotta know, is that I will never forget you. But, you’ve got things you have to do now, and so do I. And so… I’m gonna get on this spaceship, (smoke starts pouring in from the ceiling, and a ladder comes down, with flashing, coloured lights on the side of it) and I’m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels. But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone. But I won’t have aged at all. (gets on the ladder) So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne, baby, I’m gonna want to meet her.
(The ladder retracts, taking Joey up into the spaceship for his voyage to Blargon 7, and Kate waves good bye.)

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: So long, Vic! (waving good bye as the ladder retracts)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang, except Joey, is there. Phoebe is, well you y’know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, it’s been two days.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know. Oh, good thing it’s one of those 801 numbers. Right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, no, oh no-no-no, it’s has to be 800. (picks up the instruction manual to check the phone number) ‘Cause all those big companies have 800 numbers, every one. (Finds the number) Yeah, every big Utah-based company has one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoe-be!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry, I’m so sorry, I will pay you back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And yet, she’s still not hanging up the phone.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hang it up! Hang up the phone!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! Fine! (slams the phone down, breaking it) Oh-oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I think I broke it. But that’s all right, here’s the number you can call.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.
